sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K823001
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Korinna Kraft
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: PliaI is the promoter of the PliaI gene of Bacillus subtilis, which is inducible by bacitracin. It does not contain a ribosome binding site.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K1074013
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Changlong Zhao
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: This part is a sigma factor A-dependent promotor of the gene sdpR derived from the B.subtilis ,and it contains an operon for the signaling pathway of sdpc,a bacterial toxin of B.subtilis. It's activated as the toxin sdpC existed,while the natural pructrue of the promotor, sdpR/I ,confers immunity to the SdpC toxin. Cells of B. subtilis enter the pathway to sporulate under conditions of nutrient limitation could generate sdpC, then this promotor would be activated. We use this part to overexpress sdpC toxin in spore-forming cells,to build a self-killing system in B.subtilis for safety thinking.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: from the genome of Bacillus subtilis WB800N

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K823003
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Korinna Kraft
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: Pveg is a strong, constitutive promoter of Bacillus subtilis

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K823000
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Korinna Kraft
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: Promoter of the liaG gene of Bacillus subtilis, weak constitutive

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K090504
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Daniel Goodman
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription:
This is a strong constitutive (always-on) promoter for use with gram-positive organisms. It requires a downstream gram-positive ribosomal binding site and coding sequence to function. We only have experience using this part in B. subtilis, but it should function in most gram-positive organisms. It has not been tested and will most likely not work in E. coli.
The promoter comes from the cis-regulatory region of the uracil phosphatase in Bacillus cereus. We functionally annotated the promoter ourselves using the DBTBS database motif search feature. (dbtbs.hgc.jp)
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: This part generates high expression in gram-positive organisms, and it may be possible to generate deleterious effects on the cell if used to express certain protein products.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: We PCRed this part out of the pAD43-25 gram positive vector, acquired from the Bacillus Genetic Stock Center (bgsc.org), catalog number ECE166.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: P43
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:description: Promoter 43 a constitutive promoter for B. subtilis
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: James Chappell
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: Promoter 43 is a constitutive promoter that constitutively expresses the P43 protein in ''B.subtilis''. This promoter has been shown to be recognized and active during the exponential and lag phases of growth. It has been hypothesized that the ability to recognize the promoter in exponential and lag phase of growth is due to the recognition of the promoter by both sigma factor 55 (the major sigma factor) and sigma factor 37 (the lag phase sigma factor) <cite>1</cite>. The P43 promoter has been previously used for constitutive expression of exogenous genes within ''B.subtilis'' vectors <cite>2</cite>. The context with which we used the promoter P43 is as a '''Polymerase Per Second''' (PoPS) generator.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: The biobrick part was designed to include the binding sites for both the sigma factor A and B. In addition the biobrick standard was applied to the promoter P43 sequence.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: The part was designed using the sequence from the ''B.subtilis'' genome and from previously published papers <cite>2</cite>. This sequence was then synthesised by Geneart.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: Pveg
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:description: Promoter veg a constitutive promoter for B. subtilis
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: James Chappell
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: Pveg is a constitutive promoter that constitutively expresses the P43 protein in ''B.subtilis''. Pveg contains binding sites for the ''B.sutbilis'' major sigma factor<cite>#1</cite>. Pveg in ''B.subtilis'' utilises two binding sites to cause high expression of genes<cite>#2</cite>, however our Pveg is lacking the upstream site to give a medium level of gene expression. It has been noted that the sporulation master regulatoion factor spoOA interacts with Pveg though it is not known how<cite>#3</cite>. The context with which we used the promoter Pveg is as a '''Polymerase Per Second''' (PoPS) generator.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: The biobrick part was designed to include a single binding site for the ''B.subtilis major sigma factor. In addition the biobrick standard was applied to the promoter Pveg sequence.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: The Pveg promoter was suggested to us by Dr. Jan-Willem Veening of Newcastle University. This sequence supplied was compared to that of the DBTBS database<cite>#3</cite> then a section containing the binding site synthesised by Geneart.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K780003
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:description: Strong constitutive promoter for Bacillus subtilis
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Elżbieta Jankowska
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: Strong constitutive promoter for Bacillus subtilis

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K823002
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Korinna Kraft
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: PlepA is the promoter of the PlepA gene of Bacillus subtilis. It is a constitutive promoter and does not contain a ribosome binding site.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K090501
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Daniel Goodman
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: This is an IPTG-inducible promoter for use with gram-positive organisms. It requires a downstream gram-positive ribosomal binding site and coding sequence to function. We only have experience using this part in B. subtilis, but it should function in most gram-positive organisms. It has not been tested and will most likely not work in E. coli.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes:
We found the functional annotation in the associated paper: Kaltwasser M., T. Wiegert, and W. Schumann. 2002. Construction and Application of Epitope- and Green Fluorescent Protein-Tagging Integration Vectors for Bacillus subtilis. Appl. Environ. Microbiol 68:2624-2628
The primers we used to extract it (sans biobrick ends) are as follow: Forward: AGAACAACCTCTGCTAAAATTC Reverse: AAGCTTAATTGTTATCCGCTC
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: We PCRed this part out of the pMUTIN-YFP gram positive vector, acquired from the Bacillus Genetic Stock Center (bgsc.org), catalog number ECE151.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: Ph-s
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Chris Hirst
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: Promoter hyper-spank is an inducible promoter that has been designed for high expression in ''B.subtilis''. Gene expression under the promoter hyper-spank can be induced by addition of Isopropyl β-D-1-thiogalactopyranoside (IPTG). The context with which we used the promoter hyper-spank, was to take an input of IPTG and give '''Polymerase Per Second'''(PoPS) as an output. IPTG does not induce the promoter hyper-spank directly, but requires the transcriptional regulator '''LacI''', (<bbpart>BBa_K413035</bbpart>). This means that LacI must be constitutively expressed in ''B.subtilis'' in order to use the promoter hyper-spank.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: Biobrick standard was applied to the promoter hyper-spank sequence.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: The part was designed using the sequence from the ''B.subtilis'' genome and from previously published papers <cite>1</cite><cite>2</cite><cite>3</cite>. This sequence was then synthesised by Geneart.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: Pxyl
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: James Chappell
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription:
Promoter Xylose is an inducible promoter that has been designed for high expression in ''B.subtilis''. Gene expression under the promoter xylose can be induced by addition of xylose. The context with which we used the promoter xylose, was to take an input of xylose and give '''Polymerase Per Second'''(PoPS) as an output.
Promoter xylose is an inducible promoter that has been designed for high expression in ''B.subtilis''. Gene expression under the promoter xylose can be induced by addition of xylose. The context with which we used the promoter xylose, was to take an input of xylose and give '''Polymerase Per Second'''(PoPS) as an output. Xylose does not induce the promoter xylose directly, but requires the transcriptional regulator '''XylR''', (BBa_K143036) This means that XylR must be constitutively expressed in ''B.subtilis'' in order to use the promoter xylose.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: Biobrick standard was applied to the promoter xylose sequence.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: The part was designed using the sequence from the ''B.subtilis'' genome and from previously published papers <cite>1</cite><cite>2</cite>. This sequence was then synthesised by Geneart.
